snippet: A meaningless spat obscures health care issues that Mitt Romney does not want to address in order to keep the Republican Party’s conservative base happy.
abstract: Editorial contends that Mitt Romney's inconsistent arguments about the individual mandate contained within the health care reform law illustrate his inch-deep position on the issue; observes that he has no plan for addressing the nation's problematic health care system, and his confused stance indicates his willingness to pander to the Republican Party's conservative base.
lead_paragraph: A meaningless spat obscures health care issues that Mitt Romney does not want to address in order to keep the Republican Party’s conservative base happy.

headline.seo: Mr. Romney Changes His Mind, Again, on Health Care
headline.main: Mr. Romney Changes His Mind, Again
headline.print_headline: Mr. Romney Changes His Mind, Again

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
